description: APPLICATION FOR PROPOSED REPLACEMENT ROOF TO EXISTING OUTBUILDING
decision_conditions:
Reason : 1 - The scheme by reason of its combined siting and design results in an unsympathetic form of development that fails to preserve or enhance the setting, character and appearance of the host dwelling and the locality to the detriment of the visual amenity of the conservation area.  The scheme would be contrary to, in particular, Chapter 4, 12 and 14 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2023, Policies D3 and HC1 London Plan 2021, Policy CS14 Merton Core Planning Strategy 2011, Policies DM D2 and DMD4 of Merton Sites and Policies Plan 2014.
Reason : 2 - The proposed development reason of its siting and height is considered to reauslt in a visually intrusive and overbearing form of development that will increase the sense of enclosure to nearby occupants, in particular, no. 247 Coombe Lane and no. 14 Westcoombe Avenue. Therefore, the proposal would be contrary to, in particular, Chapters 4 and 12 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2023, Policy D3 of the London Plan 2021, Policy CS 14 Merton LDF Core Planning Strategy 2011 and Policies DM D2 and DM D3 of the Merton Sites and Policies Plan 2014.
Reason : 3 - INFORMATIVE
The applicant is informed there are inaccuracies on the submitted drawings. 
Reason : 3 - INFORMATIVE
The applicant is informed there are inaccuracies on the submitted drawings. 
Reason : 4 - INFORMATIVE
Note to Applicant
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton  (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:
"	Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
"	Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
"	As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.
In this instance:
"	The application was not considered to comply with the provisions of the Development Plan and NPPF as submitted, and would have required substantial changes such that a new application would be required. 
"	It is noted that the applicant/agent did not engage in any pre-application discussions.
"	The applicant is advised to seek pre-application advice on any resubmission.
